result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan Morgan Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to Trempealeau County case numbers 08CF51, 08CF91, 19CF122 and 21CF350 (Monroe County Case) and any other prison sentence defendant is currently serving. 

In the event that the defendant is discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent SHALL notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment SHALL be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is to pay court costs.
Defendant is to receive a AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. Defendant is to comply with any treatment/programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

ADDRESS INFO for Jonathan Morgan Peterson
Current: Waupun Correctional Institution, PO Box 351, Waupun, WI 53963 United States  (Effective: 02-01-2022)
Prior: Dodge Correctional Institution P.O. Box 700, Waupun, WI 53963

ADA Mike Diaz appeared in person for the State. Defendant appeared by video in custody from Waupun Correctional.  ATTY Christine Kuczynski appeared in person specially for Defendant. Courts advise defendant of rights. Defendant KVI rights. Defendant enters plea to sole count. Court finds defendant guilty. Defendant sentenced.

ADA Mike Diaz appeared in person for the State. Defendant appeared by video in custody from Waupun Correctional.  ATTY Christine Kuczynski appeared in person specially for Defendant. Court advised Defendant of rights. Court reviews complaint with Defendant. Defendant waives reading of complaint. Defendant wishes to waive PH. Court finds Defendant KVI waives right PH and finds probable cause felony committed and binds over. Information filed. Defendant waives reading of information. Proceeds to PLEAS.
